subject: Art & Design
title: Alexander McQueen: Fashion as Dark Art
description: A 60-second lesson on Alexander McQueen: Fashion as Dark Art.

hook.text: McQueen's 1999 show had a model in a white dress spray-painted by robots in real time. Fashion as live performance art.

buildup.text: Lee Alexander McQueen fused technical tailoring with emotional storytelling.

discovery.text: Trained on Savile Row, he could construct garments as precisely as any couturier. Skill fueled his rebellion.

twist.text: His shows addressed trauma, colonialism, and nature's destruction. Fashion critics debated: is this art or shock value?

climax.text: His skull-print scarf became fashion's most copied accessory.

quiz.question: What set Alexander McQueen apart from other fashion designers?
options: He combined precise technical tailoring with emotional, theatrical storytelling
